text: __NOTOC__ Sigeferth or Sigefirth or Sicgga, was the third Bishop of Selsey, consecrated in 733Kelly "South Saxons, kings of the (act. 477–772)" Oxford Dictionary of National Biography by Tatwine, the Archbishop of Canterbury. Sigeferth was still bishop in 747, when he attended the Synod of Clofesho. His date of death was sometime between 747 and 765.Fryde, et al. Handbook of British Chronology p. 221 ==Citations== ==References== * * ==External links== * Category:Bishops of Selsey Category:8th-century bishops
title: Sigeferth of Selsey
